files.README.md:
# Build Insights Logger Skill for Claude Code

A Claude Code plugin marketplace providing automatic logging of meaningful insights, discoveries, and decisions during coding sessions.

## Overview

This marketplace contains a specialized skill that automatically captures non-trivial learnings about edge cases, design decisions, patterns, and implementation details during development. The skill logs insights to session files in `.claude/insights/` and helps transfer valuable learnings to CLAUDE.md for long-term institutional knowledge preservation.

## Installation

To add this marketplace to your Claude Code installation:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add nathanonn/claude-skill-build-insights-logger
```

After adding the marketplace, the `build-insights-logger` skill will be available for installation and will automatically activate when building complex code where institutional knowledge should be preserved.

## Available Plugins

### build-insights-logger

**Type:** Project Skill (Managed)

**Description:** Automatically log meaningful insights, discoveries, and decisions during coding sessions to preserve institutional knowledge and track codebase evolution.

**Features:**

-   Automatic logging of insights during complex implementations
-   Captures non-trivial learnings about:
    -   Edge cases and unexpected behaviors
    -   Design decisions and architectural trade-offs
    -   Performance and security considerations
    -   API design patterns and state management
    -   Testing strategies and error handling approaches
-   Session-based logging to `.claude/insights/` directory
-   Interactive review workflow for selecting insights to preserve
-   Transfer valuable learnings to CLAUDE.md
-   Archive completed sessions for historical reference

**When It Activates:**

The skill automatically activates when:
-   Working on complex implementations with non-trivial design decisions
-   Discovering edge cases or unexpected behaviors
-   Making architectural or performance trade-offs
-   Implementing security-sensitive features
-   Building features where institutional knowledge matters

## Usage

Once installed, the skill works in two phases:

### 1. Automatic Logging

During development, Claude will automatically log insights as they're discovered:

```
üìù Logged insight about null handling in API responses
üìù Logged insight about performance optimization in data loading
üìù Logged insight about state management pattern selection
```

Insights are logged to timestamped session files in `.claude/insights/session-YYYY-MM-DD-HHMMSS.md`

### 2. Review & Selection

When you're ready to preserve key learnings, ask Claude to review:

-   "Review insights" - See all insights from the current session
-   "Show me what we learned" - Review and select insights to add to CLAUDE.md
-   "Summarize insights" - Get an overview of captured learnings

Claude will present insights grouped by category, and you can select which ones to transfer to CLAUDE.md for permanent reference.

## Prerequisites

-   Claude Code CLI installed and configured
-   No additional dependencies required

## Repository Structure

```
.claude/
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ build-insights-logger/
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md              # Skill definition and complete documentation
```

## Development

To test this marketplace locally:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add ./path/to/claude-skill-build-insights-logger
```

## Support

For issues, questions, or contributions, please visit:

-   Repository: https://github.com/nathanonn/claude-skill-build-insights-logger
-   Contact: hello@nathanonn.com

## License

MIT License - see LICENSE file for details

## About Build Insights Logger

Build Insights Logger helps development teams capture and preserve institutional knowledge that would otherwise be lost. By automatically logging meaningful discoveries and decisions during coding sessions, it creates a living history of why the codebase evolved the way it did - making onboarding easier, preventing repeated mistakes, and preserving valuable context for future developers.

marketplaces.name: ai-elements-marketplace
marketplaces.description: Intelligent documentation system for AI Elements component library. Activate automatically when working with AI-native applications or when AI Elements component names are mentioned (Message, Conversation, Reasoning, Canvas, etc.). Provides context-aware documentation retrieval - fetches examples for implementation queries, component references for API lookups, and smart multi-page fetching for complex tasks.

files.README.md:
# AI Elements Skill for Claude Code

A Claude Code plugin marketplace providing intelligent documentation and implementation support for the AI Elements component library.

## Overview

This marketplace contains a specialized skill that provides context-aware documentation retrieval for AI Elements - a comprehensive library of AI-native UI components built on top of shadcn/ui. The skill automatically activates when you mention AI Elements component names (like Message, Conversation, Reasoning, Canvas, etc.) and provides smart documentation fetching based on your query context.

## Installation

To add this marketplace to your Claude Code installation:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add nathanonn/claude-skills-ai-elements
```

After adding the marketplace, the `ai-elements` skill will be available for installation and will automatically activate when working with AI-native applications.

## Available Plugins

### ai-elements

**Type:** Project Skill (Managed)

**Description:** Intelligent documentation system for AI Elements component library with automatic activation and context-aware documentation retrieval.

**Features:**

-   Automatic activation when AI Elements component names are mentioned
-   Context-aware documentation fetching:
    -   Examples for implementation queries
    -   Component references for API lookups
    -   Smart multi-page fetching for complex tasks
-   Comprehensive coverage of 31+ components
-   Implementation patterns and best practices
-   Troubleshooting guides

**Components Covered:**

-   Core: Message, Conversation, Reasoning, Canvas
-   Messaging: MessageList, MessageInput, MessageActions
-   Interactive: Copilot, ExpandableSection, InlineCompletion
-   Display: CardList, ContentDisplay, InteractiveHighlight
-   And 25+ more components

## Usage

Once installed, the skill automatically provides documentation when you:

-   Mention AI Elements component names in your queries
-   Request implementation examples
-   Ask for component API references
-   Work on AI-native application development

Example queries that will activate the skill:

-   "How do I implement the Message component?"
-   "Show me examples of using Conversation"
-   "What props does the Reasoning component accept?"
-   "Help me build a chatbot with AI Elements"

## Prerequisites

-   Claude Code CLI installed and configured
-   Basic familiarity with React and TypeScript (for implementation)
-   Understanding of shadcn/ui components (recommended)

## Repository Structure

```
.claude/
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ai-elements/
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md              # Skill definition and metadata
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ INDEX.md              # Searchable component reference
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/
            ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md         # Overview and categories
            ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ introduction.md   # Getting started guide
            ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ usage.md          # Implementation patterns
            ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ troubleshooting.md# Common issues and solutions
            ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/       # 31 component docs
            ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ examples/         # Tutorial files
```

## Development

To test this marketplace locally:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add ./path/to/claude-skills-ai-elements
```

## Support

For issues, questions, or contributions, please visit:

-   Repository: https://github.com/nathanonn/claude-skills-ai-elements
-   Contact: hello@nathanonn.com

## License

MIT License - see LICENSE file for details

## About AI Elements

AI Elements is a comprehensive library of AI-native UI components designed to help developers build sophisticated AI interfaces quickly. Built as an extension of shadcn/ui, it provides components specifically designed for AI interactions, conversations, reasoning displays, and more.
